Title: R for Social Data Science
About: R for Social Data Science course from Trinity College Dublin introduces participants to the core programming concepts, such as functions, variables, conditions, loops, working with libraries, and interacting with APIs. It also covers data management and visualisation. Best practices in project workflow and version control will also be introduced using Github.
Study_Description: R for Social Data Science course fromTrinity College Dublinwill introduce participants to basic computer programming skills for social data analysis.

Abilities.item: Describe basic programming terminology, structures, and conventions.

Programme_Structure.item: Sessions 1 & 2: Computation: Discuss core software development concepts such as computers
Sessions 3 & 4, R Basics: Environments, variables, assignment, and object types. Start using some built-in functions to describe data.
Sessions 5 & 6, Control Flow: Branching, if-else statements, and loops.
Sessions 8 & 9, Functions: Main building block of a program implemented in any computing language, learning how to construct them.
Sessions 10 & 11: Learn how to eliminate errors in structured ways and debug, measure execution time and benchmarking of specific operations.
Sessions 12 & 13: Focus on data frames (base R) and its tidyverse cousin tibble. We will also discuss formats of data storage and functions for data I/O and descriptive analysis.
Sessions 14 & 15: Learn how to plot data in different formats using base R and gglot.

General_Requirements.item: Places are limited as class sizes are small, with up to 30 per class, so enroll as soon as possible to secure your place on the course.

You can enroll on the course directly via the PayPal link on the website. The course fee includes access to the course materials via Blackboard (Trinity’s virtual learning environment) for the duration of the course. Participation in this CPD course does not include access to the Trinity Library or any other student services (including a student identity card).

Title: Social Data Analysis
About: This Social Data Analysis course from Trinity College Dublin teaches students how to apply quantitative methods to conduct causal impact analysis using data.
Study_Description: In particular,Social Data Analysisstudents atTrinity College Dublinwill learn how econometric methods can be used to answer questions related to human behaviour and strategic decision-making with the help of regression based econometric methods.

Abilities.item: Determine which methods can be used to analyse different datasets for addressing questions relevant to the social sciences.

Programme_Structure.item: The CPD focuses on applied causal regression analysis providing an understanding of econometric methods for use with big data. In particular, the course covers regression-based evaluation methods to assess the casual relationships between different factors at play.
These include the use of panel data, difference-in-differences estimation, matching and regression discontinuity designs, randomised experiments, and natural or quasi-experiments.

The CPD has an applied focus, demonstrating the use of these methods with practical applications using the statistical software package R and referring to examples from recent studies that apply those methods to answer key questions in the social sciences.

General_Requirements.item: Participants are expected to have basic computer skills and some quantitative experience through prior training in statistics, such as degree or equivalent experience.
Participants should have access to a desktop or laptop with camera and a microphone.

General_Requirements.item: This programme is designed for mid-senior leaders who have an ambition or remit to become innovation ambassadors within their organisation – including but not limited to those with at least three years of people management experience. It is particularly suited to those wishing to foster a culture of originality, ingenuity and creativity in themselves, their teams and their organisations. The programme does not assume any prior knowledge or training in the subject areas.

Title: Workplace Wellbeing
About:
Wellbeing is a core value of most societies, albeit conceptualised, defined, and promoted in diverse ways. Join the Workplace Wellbeing (An
Organisational Psychology Approach) course at Trinity College Dublin.
Study_Description: Deriving primarily from a psychological perspective, this course introduces participants to a socio-technical systems model of workplace wellbeing, contextualising the organisation’s role between individual’s own wellbeing management, the services, infrastructure and policies in society and the physical infrastructure and technological environment.

Abilities.item: An understanding of what the workplace wellbeing is and how it can be measured.
The ability to conceptualise the organisation as a socio-technical system with wellbeing as a key outcome.
An understanding of the psychosocial, organisational, contextual, and societal factors influencing wellbeing.
An appreciation of leadership and change management strategies needed to design and deliver effective wellbeing initiatives.
The ability to apply their knowledge to evaluating wellbeing initiatives.

General_Requirements.item: Places are limited, so enroll as soon as possible to secure your place on the course.

You can enroll on the course directly via the PayPal link on the website. The course fee includes access to the course materials via Blackboard (Trinity’s virtual learning environment) for the duration of the course. Participation in this CPD course does not include access to the Trinity Library or any other student services (including a student identity card).
For the best online experience, we recommend using Chrome as your default browser, along with a USB (or other) headset with built in microphone.

Title: Python for Social Data Science
About: The Python for Social Data Science programme from Trinity College Dublin goes beyond social data analytics to address causal analysis and consider social issues that are important to industries such as inequality, unemployment, climate change and ethics.
Study_Description: This Python for Social Data Science course from Trinity College Dublin addresses the scarcity of training in data science in Ireland. Co-created with key industry partners, the programme trains participants in the fundamental knowledge and skills of social data analysis.

Abilities.item: Describe basic programming terminology, structures, and conventions.

Programme_Structure.item: The CPD familiarizedsparticipants to the core programming concepts, including functions, variables, conditions, loops, data structures, working with libraries, and interacting with APIs. It also covers data management and visualisation. Best practices in project workflow will also be taught using GitHub.
Participants will engage with the material in a hands-on environment, which will include programming exercises throughout the CPD.

General_Requirements.item: Places are limited as class sizes are small, so enroll as soon as possible to secure your place on the course.

You can enroll on the course directly via the PayPal link. The course fee includes access to the course materials via Blackboard (Trinity’s virtual learning environment) for the duration of the course. Participation in this CPD course does not include access to the Trinity Library or any other student services (including a student identity card).
Participants should have access to a laptop with camera and a microphone.

Title: Introduction to Intercultural Communication for the Global Workplace
About: This Introduction to Intercultural Communication for the Global Workplace course from Trinity College Dublin was designed by the Trinity Centre for Global Intercultural Communications to provide participants with novel methods for successful intercultural collaboration, inclusive management and effective communications across cultures.
Study_Description: With an applied focus, participants will learn about perspectives on intercultural collaboration through real case studies and apply these newly developed skills to their own work and contexts.

Abilities.item: Intercultural communication.

Programme_Structure.item: The first two weeks of this CPD will familiarize relevant perspectives on cultural diversity and methods of localisation and multimedia storytelling for intercultural communication.

In weeks three and four participants will have the opportunity of seeing how these perspectives and methods work on the ground through the analysis of empirical evidence and case studies from diverse African and Latin American countries that are key partners for Irish organisations and entrepreneurs.

During the last two weeks of the course, participants will assess intercultural practices both at the individual level and in the workplace and they will design an intercultural communication strategy.

General_Requirements.item: Places are limited, so enroll as soon as possible to secure your place on the course.

You can enroll on the course directly via the PayPal link below. The course fee includes access to the course materials via Blackboard (Trinity’s virtual learning environment) for the duration of the course. Participation in this CPD course does not include access to the Trinity Library or any other student services (including a student identity card).

Title: Sustainable Specialist
About: This highly specialized Sustainable Specialist Program Certificate from Les Roches eAcademy puts you on a path to comprehending and championing sustainability in our ever-evolving world.
Study_Description: The three component courses from theSustainable Specialistprogramme fromLes Roches eAcademyall tackle specific topic areas in depth. In Sustainability Matters, you'll gain a comprehensive understanding of sustainability across diverse dimensions, empowering you to advocate for a more sustainable future.

Programme_Structure.item: Energy Management Initiatives equips you with the knowledge and skills needed for effective energy management, fostering informed decisions that benefit the environment and your organization's bottom line. Topics covered include the role of artificial intelligence (AI), the transformative potential of the Internet of Things (IoT), and the important role of renewable energy in reducing carbon footprints.

The Sustainable Landscape course explores the intersection of nature, culture, and responsible tourism, emphasizing the creation of environments that enhance natural beauty, support cultural and ecological sustainability, and promote responsible tourism.

General_Requirements.item: To obtain additional information about the program, we kindly suggest that you visit the programme website, where you can find further details and relevant resources.

Title: Hotel Valuation and Performance
About: The Hotel Valuation and Performance course from Les Roches eAcademy opens a window into the world of hospitality real estate asset valuation and performance assessment.
Study_Description: Across two intensive weeks, you will apply different valuation techniques across a range of real-world case studies, while also investigating some of key drivers of asset value today, including reputation, brand value and data management.

Abilities.item: Learn the principles and techniques used to evaluate current and predicted hotel property performance

General_Requirements.item: There are no admission criteria for the program

Title: ESG Online Program - Driving Sustainable Transformation
About: The ESG Online Program - Driving Sustainable Transformation at WU Executive Vienna covers covers key concepts of ESG Management (environmental, social, and governance), systemic thinking, strategic implementation, and leadership for sustainability.  Equipping participants with the tools to effectively link sustainability efforts to financial performance and innovation.
University: WU (Vienna University of Economics and Business)
Study_Description: TheESG Online Program - Driving Sustainable Transformationat WU Executive Vienna explores the strategic alignment of corporate sustainability initiatives between sustainability, innovation and profit. Europe in particular plays a vital role in shaping this sustainable transformation. European companies provide best practices for ESG ( (environmental, social, and governance) implementation on a global scale. This knowledge enables decision-makers, employees, and civil society actors to bridge systemic thinking with strategic action, deepening their overall understanding of sustainability and maximizing their potential for impactful change.

Abilities.item: Conceptual foundations of ESG management and terminology
Storytelling and communicating sustainability
AACSB

Programme_Structure.item: Contextualization: History, themes and terminology of ESG
managers who want to incorporate ESG considerations into their organizations
individuals who are curious about the ESG landscape from a European perspective
individuals aiming to integrate ESG principles into their business strategy
learners pursuing a career in ESG investing and sustainability management

Title: Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Development
About: The Sustainable Hospitality and Tourism Development course from Les Roches eAcademy offers a deep dive into the dynamics of sustainability within the context of the international tourism and hospitality industry.
Study_Description: Across three intensive weeks, you’ll examine how the circular economy, quality of life, and corporate social responsibility can become strategic tools for growth. The course will also showcase the different aspects of development in diverse environments and landscapes.

Abilities.item: Learn how sustainability practices are adopted within a hospitality context

Programme_Structure.item: Sustainability & the Hospitality and Tourism Industry
Sustainability & the Hospitality and Tourism Company

General_Requirements.item: There are no admission criteria for the program

Title: Applied Generative AI
About: Build and deploy Generative AI solutions to solve complex business challenges. Learn from Johns Hopkins University faculty and industry leaders to gain practical skills during the Applied Generative AI certificate.
Study_Description: The certificate programme inApplied Generative AIfromJohns Hopkins Universityis a comprehensive 16-week online course designed for professionals eager to leverage Generative AI to solve business challenges and drive innovation within their organizations.
